page.title: 19Morwenstow - School
page.content: St. Mark's Voluntary Primary School was founded as a Church School on the present site circa 1842 by the Revd. R.S.Hawker. Formerly an all-age elem- entary school decapitated in 1955 it now provides for mixed infants and juniors. Children start at 4+ and transfer to Budehaven School at 11+. At present there are 55 children on the roll with Headteacher and 1.1 assistants to be increased to Head+ 2.2 in September 1985. Non-teaching staff include secretary, cook and helper, cleaner, auxiliary aide and meals supervisor. A New Governing Body of 9 members is to be formed in Autumn 1985. Mid-day meals are provided. Transport is prov- ided as laid down in the 1944 Act. There is a swimming pool field, hard court and shrubbery.
